title: Circular Array Shift
problem_statement:
Circular Array Shift

Problem Description

You are given an integer array A of length N. You are allowed to perform any number of circular left or right shifts, each by 1 unit. Your task is to find and return an integer value representing the minimum number of circular shifts required such that at least one element becomes equal to its 1-based index. Return -1 if no such shift is possible.

Input Specification:

  • input1: An integer value N, representing the number of elements.
  • input2: An integer array A.

Output Specification:

Return an integer value representing the minimum number of circular shifts required such that at least one element becomes equal to its 1-based index. Return -1 if no such shift is possible.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: input1 = 5, input2 = [5,3,2,1,4]
Output: 1

Explanation: Here, there are 5 elements in the array which are (5,3,2,1,4). We can find the circular shifts as below:

  1. On left shifting once, the array will become (3,2,1,4,5). Here, the elements 2, 4 and 5 both become equal to their index.
  2. On right shifting once, the array will become (4,5,3,2,1). Here, element 3 becomes equal to its index value.

There can be multiple scenarios here, but the minimum shift required to bring any one element equal to its index value is just 1. Hence, 1 is returned as the output.

Example 2:

Input: input1 = 3, input2 = [9,8,7]
Output: -1

Explanation: Here, there are 3 elements in the array which are (9,8,7). There is no way that any of the given values will match any of the index (1,2,3). Since there are no possible shifts that can make it happen, -1 is returned as the output.

Constraints

No explicit constraints were provided in the problem statement.

Provided Code Structure (Java)

import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

// Read only region start
class UserMainCode
{
  public int elementShift(int input1,int[] input2){
    // Read only region end
    // Write code here...
    int nnn = input1;
    int arr[] = input2;
    for(int shift = 0; shift < nnn; shift++){
      for(int pos = 0; pos < nnn; pos++){
        int source_index = (pos + shift)%nnn;
        if(arr[source_index] == pos+1){
          if(shift == 0){
            return 0;
          }
          return Math.min(shift, nnn-shift);
        }
      }
    }
    return -1;
  }
}
